page.title: 07FARMING 1
page.content: Farming is the main industry. Most of the farms have about 150 acres, and are mixed units,combining arable and cattle and sheep. The main arable crop is barley as there is very little oat growing. Several farms grow their own barley which is then converted into barley-beef.They raise barley-beef intensively,keeping their stock in sheds all the year round. Very few farmers raise potatoes which is contrary to the custom ten years ago. Many farms run their own dairy herds which are usually Friesians. The normal size of herd is 60 milking cows and approximately 30 followers. Some farmers'wives run their own poultry and sell the eggs at the door. These are usually free-range but one farm keeps 2,000 battery hens.
